results.title: Gold is forever
results.creator_credit: Bob Talbot and Bob Talbot Productions
results.brief_description: A film designed to show the strains, stresses, dedication and training methods of marathon runners. Australia’s Derek Clayton features in the film. Highlights his great effort in the Munich Olympic Games, 1972.

results.title: Gold from the sea: epics of salvage
results.creator_credit: A G Harbrow and United Salvage
results.brief_description: Shows the salvaging of gold bullion from the RMS “Niagara” which was struck by a mine off the coast of New Zealand during WWII.

results.title: Gold fever
results.creator_credit: Jeff Spencer, George Cass, Victoria. Schools Division. Curriculum Branch and TV Ed Productions
results.brief_description: They came to get rich quickly and escape poverty in their homelands, but what they found was not always wealth. This program looks at life on the goldfields and discusses some of the problems that the diggers encountered. Sovereign Hill at Ballarat is featured.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jeff Spencer, George Cass, Victoria. Schools Division. Curriculum Branch and TV Ed Productions

results.title: Gold diggers Of 1933
results.creator_credit: Busby Berkeley, Mervyn LeRoy, Jack L. Warner, Robert Lord and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: Dick Powell and Ruby Keeler play two young hopefuls struggling to make it on Broadway. Even falling in love has its hardships, as Powell’s high-brow Eastern family is determined to break them (and the show) up. More complications set in when his brother falls for Keeler’s wise-cracking roommate. Cast also includes Warren William, Joan blondell, Ginger Rogers. Based on a play by Avery Hopwood. Musical numbers created and directed by Busby Berkeley.

results.title: Gold diggers' ballad: the watercolours of S.T.Gill (1818-80)
results.creator_credit: Tim Burstall, Patrick Ryan and Eltham Films
results.brief_description: The famous watercolours by S. T. Gill reflect the optimism and feeling or spirit of the goldrushes. The gold diggers’ expressive faces and activities show the tremendous fever and hunger after gold in the 1850’s in Victoria. The paintings are presented with a background of Australian ballads with guitar accompaniment.

results.title: Going to school in Australia
results.creator_credit: Kenneth Mott, Nicholas and Austarama Television
results.brief_description: A film designed to instruct immigrants to Australia on the nature of the Australian and especially the Victorian education systems. Two representatives in the field of migrant education are questioned about how parents may proceed to enrol their children at school, the different kinds of schools in the Australian system, their various functions and facilities, adult education and several other facets of the education system. Narrated by Barry McQueen.

results.title: Going to school
results.creator_credit: David Gibson and Dept of Education, New Zealand
results.brief_description: Explores a child’s first days at school. This exciting experience has its problems, fears and joys. It also describes the parents and teachers reactions. Suitable for tertiary and teacher levels.

results.title: Going through customs
results.creator_credit: Rolly Desmarais, Rolly Productions and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Every day, streams of people, goods and commodities of all descriptions come into Canada at border crossings along the 6 500 km Canada-U.S. border, and via airports and seaports. Keeping the traffic moving expeditiously, at the same time ensuring that Canadian government regulations concerning immigration, customs and excise, health, and agriculture are observed, is the job of the Customs Officer. This is a colorful, coast-to-coast look at the variety that enters into his day.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Rolly Desmarais, Rolly Productions and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Going the distance
results.creator_credit: Paul Cowan, Jacques Bobet, Robert Verrall and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: The official film of the XI Commonwealth Games held in Edmonton, Canada, in August 1978. An international sports event occurring every four years, the games draw hundreds of athletes from the many nations of the Commonwealth. Eight athletes from four continents were selected to illustrate the nature of individual effort. They were filmed in their home countries before the Games, and in competition in Edmonton, Canada.

results.title: Going Solo
results.brief_description:
Through life experiences such as divorce, bereavement or never meeting the right soulmate we may find ourselves fifty plus and living on our own. For some in this situation a new partner is not what they crave, just the supportive friendship of those who understand.

Based on a series of interviews conducted with members of a Catholic Women’s solo group, this 36 min amateur documentary is a first time effort for the filmmaker and although the production values are at times questionable - the heart and soul of the women interviewed shine through making this a warm, often funny and inspirational account of life for a growing number of people in our community.
